skos:Concept.skos:scopeNote: {"id": "06cc9abc-7d05-477a-a537-c09f0610813c", "value": "Appropriate for all assets, as judged against local characteristics."}

{"id": "c81e0b67-ab70-4c7c-9698-1876be37d5af", "value": "Although local heritage lists have long been developed successfully for buildings, all\nheritage asset types, including monuments, sites, places, areas, parks, gardens and\ndesigned landscapes may be considered for inclusion"}

{"id": "1db55775-5413-4c1f-bd50-1d248ce1c2e2", "value": "The age of an asset may be an important criterion, and the age range can be adjusted to take into account distinctive local characteristics or building traditions."}

{"id": "b1309a19-6573-420e-a5af-86585c385ed7", "value": "A significant historical association of local or national note, including links to important local figures, may enhance the significance of a heritage asset. Blue Plaque and similar schemes may be relevant. Social and communal interest may be regarded as a sub-set of historic interest but has special value in local listing. As noted in the PPG: \u2018Heritage assets \u2026 can also provide meaning for communities derived from their collective experience of a place and can symbolise wider values such as faith and cultural identity\u2019. It therefore relates to places perceived as a source of local identity, distinctiveness, social interaction and coherence, contributing to the \u2018collective memory\u2019 of a place."}
{"id": "3547fbfb-f1eb-4371-a80d-3e7da3a072fd", "value": "Groupings of assets with a clear visual design or historic relationship."}

{"id": "f5bcf552-6174-49a9-a5a1-6efafe677737", "value": "The intrinsic design and aesthetic value of an asset relating to local and/or national\nstyles, materials, construction and craft techniques, or any other distinctive\ncharacteristics."}

{"id": "68292c03-12ed-4de5-bb48-752dfb9718c8", "value": "An asset with strong communal or historical associations, or because it has especially\nstriking aesthetic value, may be singled out as a landmark within the local scene."}

skos:ConceptScheme.dcterms:description:
{"id": "1ca1bed9-06c2-4097-acbc-4ad229f9e318", "value": "Commonly applied selection criteria for assessing the
suitability of assets for inclusion in a local heritage list. Such criteria are
often adapted from those used for national designations but it is important
that the community develops criteria which respond to the local heritage of
their area. These criteria are therefore given here as a suggestion of the kind
of matters which those leading the development of a local heritage list may
wish to consider."}
skos:ConceptScheme.dcterms:title: {"id": "13e93203-cc25-44bc-84a2-6c30f9492200", "value": "Local Heritage List Criteria"}

skos:Concept.skos:scopeNote: {"id": "9f0c835a-e7c8-45bb-98d0-0345ec967c0b", "value": "The local heritage asset may provide evidence about past human activity in the locality, which may be in the form of buried remains, but may also be revealed in the structure of buildings or in a designed landscape, for instance. Heritage assets with archaeological interest are primary sources of evidence about the substance and evolution of places, and of the people and cultures that made them."}
